header.title: Do Old People Really Have a Distinct Smell or Is It Just a Stereotype?
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Check out my other channel TopTenz! https://www.youtube.com/user/toptenznet. . →Some of our favorites: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list.... →Subscribe for new videos every day! . https://www.youtube.com/user/TodayIFo.... . Follow Simon on social media:. https://twitter.com/SimonWhistler. https://www.instagram.com/simonwhistler/. . Never run out of things to say at the water cooler with TodayIFoundOut! Brand new videos 7 days a week!. . More from TodayIFoundOut:. . Why is Lead Bad For Humans?. https://youtu.be/tqXvwaBKtRc. . The People Who Can't Sleep. https://youtu.be/JWgjXmu0VQM. . In this video:. . Gerontologist and author of A New Wrinkle: What I Learned from Older People Who Never Acted Their Age, Dr. Eric Shapira, says it is difficult to pinpoint the cause or one main reason for the smell; it is a process of what happens to the body as we age.  Many studies show that the body's chemistry changes from within as we get older producing a certain scent.  Some may describe it as musty.  Some may call it stale.  Maybe a bit medicinal.. . Want the text version?: http://www.todayifoundout.com/index.p.... . Sources:. . http://www.scientificamerican.com/art.... http://www.webmd.com/brain/news/20120.... http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/05.... http://healthland.time.com/2012/05/31.... http://www.caring.com/articles/old-pe.... http://mentalfloss.com/article/51596/.... http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2-Nonenal

I'm in my 20s and I was once on a medication that dried my mouth out really badly. The dehydration made my mouth smell like old people.
I always thought they smelled different due to medication.
Old people do smell bad
Middle school children smell terrible.

You also forgot to mention conditions like incontinence ( pee smell ) , lack of regular bathing ( because it gets harder when we get older ) and skin rashes as a result ( skin to skin contact liken to bed sores ).

I have been wondering about this for a while, and have broken down many of the scents. Besides old-people smell, the other scents that I associate with old people ar e witch hazel water, florida water, cabbage, mothballs, and pipe tobacco. I used to hate these smells as a kid, but have grown to like many of them.

one reason some smell bad is incontinence. my grandma who was 90 leaked all the time and most of her clothes were often soaked in piss which made her smell like a dirty public toilet.

Amazingly though, my 100 ear old mother is at a care facility in western Canada where there is no "old people smell" at all. The cleaning staff has been able to suppress it completely. They traced a good part of it to urine leakage. By using disposable absorbent adult underpants on those residents with leakage issues, they have wiped out a large part of the issue. Otherwise it is just a constant campaign for cleanliness. I have been visiting her there for ears and am still surprised b the odor free atmosphere there. As well, a t age 67 myself, I was in the seniors ward at a hospital here in western Canada for 2 1/2 weeks and again, there was no particular odor in the place. Not even a "hospital" smell. My point is that some people, somewhere have researched this and figured out how to have olf people be odor free.
I smell Ben-gay and moth balls!

Old materials, including (better than today's) furniture, definitely factor into the smell of a house lived in by one person or couple for decades. If I had the money, I would want to have fabrics and upholstery, particularly mohair, that would boost the " old" effect, not for That reason, but because I like the feel of those materials.
My father bathes often, wears clean clothes and nice cologne. We had to fight with my mother to bathe, so she smelled old.

Why are we not allowed to use phones on planes that are not on airplane mode? I have been told that it is because it disrupts the pilot's signal with air traffic control, but I am skeptical that that is true in this era of technology.

The intensity of the odor could have factors in general health and socioeconomics. If the elderly person is in very poor health and impoverished, they might have a difficult time with bathing, changing their clothes regularly, and the house chores. A person with better health or more resources might have an easier time keeping up with their hygiene and housecleaning, either by themselves or by getting help.
I literally asked myself that question two days ago!

The lower testosterone in an aging man will.make him smell more ... feminine. Also, medications taken by the elderly will make them smell ... different. Factor in drier skin to the equation and you have -- the 'old people smell.'

Bad smell comes from poor hygiene and from not getting fresh clean clothes everyday. The cause may be dementia, poverty (fear of not being able to pay water and electricity or gas bills) or even poor health, as it can be extremely painful for someone suffering from severe arthrosis to have a shower or take care of the laundry. Elderly people need someone to look after them. As simple as that.
You look like you smell bad!😣
This comment section shows me just how many older people are on the internet. That makes me happy.

I've noticed two factors. 1. Older people have diminished sense of smell and so they don't realize they stink. Add in that many stop bathing daily because "I just sat in the house all day," and they don't realize how bad their BO has become. It's common for ordinary people to not notice their own BO after several days not bathing. 2. Health issues can cause stenches. Naturally occurring medical phenomena.

commentThread.commentText: My grandma smelled like Mexican spices... Considering that she lived in Tampico, Tamaulipas, Mexico. I only met her maybe 3 times in my whole life. It's a long story as to why it's like that with her but she claims that her brothers and sister like to bring up the past and she wants to forget it.

There's a certain group of people (I won't say who) that smell even as babies. Their food smells terrible and ruins lunch for everyone when they're heating it up in the breakroom, but their bodies are a whole other kind of awful. Indoors, these permeated odors linger for 6 hours or longer unless they appear on a regular basis. In those cases, you can't get rid of the smell unless you throw everything out and paint.

I can smell who a person is by their scent. It ruins the prank for people trying to sneak up behind me unless they are upwind from me. I will concur that men past puberty stink and badly, although it does help to take a shower or two a day. One reason why older men might smell more like women is that everyone's hormones go down as they get older but fat cells actually produce a small amount of estrogens and so that smell tends to predominate in everyone who is a bit older.
Aging is a form of decay. Decay produces unpleasant smells as a byproduct. What's the big mystery?

I think its a combination of sluggish immune systems leading to yeast or fungal overgrowth/chronic mild infections that cause strong smells but not noticeable symptoms, plus dental hygiene issues, plus the fact that most older folks I know are sort of.... oily... feeling - the ones with the strongest smell and I think that oiliness sort of ends up all over interior surfaces and carries the smell with it, plus easily irritated skin leading to using less soap/a gentler brand of laundry detergent and it doesn't wash away the old people smell effectively, their smell seeps into any soft surface (like it does for anyone, you know when you walk into someones house the first time unless they are the air freshener family there is a definite smell not a bad one per say just a "this house is unfamiliar" smell), plus cleaning isn't as easy when you're older (I'm not saying old people are gross, but they do miss things due to eyesight or not being able to climb a step stool etc), plus your sense of smell declines wit h age, plus the style of cooking that older people prefer seems to add to that smell. I'm not saying any of this is bad or gross btw, I basically think it's body chemistry slowly changing and breaking down and lifestyle. :3 tl;dr - They have a distinct smell because of multiple lifestyle and body changes that promote a stronger personal scent.

I am 72 and know I smell different, especially after menopause. My mouth is the same smell as we brush each day but when I am sick I know my mouth smells yuck. But it's the old stuff in the house, got rid of a lot of stuff. My husband still smells the same to me but Huia sweat seems more pronounced

Some old people, specifically old women, smel l weird because their sense of smell has clearly deteriorated. I'm 36 but I've always had some extremely sensitive senses including smell, and at times I'm completely overwhelmed to the point of nausea by the strength of perfume. To be honest, this is sometimes a problem for me even in women near or under my age, but it's much less frequent than in elderly women. There have been instances where I detect a strong odor mere seconds aft er a woman walks into my store, despite the fact that I'm a good 100 feet away from them. Again, my sense of smell has always seemed particularly sensitive, so I heavily weigh that when judging a smell, but some people just use WAY too much fragrance.

There was something in the news recently about a distinctive smell associated with Parkinson's Disease, and that the researchers are hoping to develop a cheap and easy diagnostic procedure using it, which could help with earlier diagnosis, and thus earlier treatment. This may be a factor in the "getting older" smell.

commentThread.commentText: Usually smell of stale urine.
2:34 I knew of course that bad oral hygiene will cause bad breath, but I didn't realise that it could affect your general body odour as a whole- How does that work?

replies.commentText: Bacteria in your mouth a decay goes into your gut and intestinal tract. That's why you can have a heart attack from an abscessed tooth or any kind of infection, the infection or bacteria can travel to your bloodstream. That's why people with a certain kind of liver failure smell too. Their liver cannot process the toxins so, they go into the bloodstream releasing sulfur into the bloodstream and even the lungs. They have very bad body odor and breath.

@Ruth Ruthie Huh, learn something new every day, and apparently today I'm learning a lot. I didn't know you could get a heart attack from an abscessed tooth (also don't really know what an abcsessed tooth is haha) or that liver failure gave you a distinctive smell (I though only that woman who can smell diseases could, well, smell diseases!) Makes sense though, cheers for that
